definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
surname Fei
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Rulers in Beijing are belatedly trying to befriend his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 北京的統治者們才亡羊補牢的費心思去親近他的敵人。

sentences.english: This is what we have, rather dully, taken care to affirm at first.
sentences.chinese: 這個是我們曾經費心來處理，起初是用來作爲肯定。

sentences.english: He tried in vain to write down the movement.
sentences.chinese: 他枉費心機地寫文章詆譭這場運動。

sentences.english: Panel painting involved a painstaking , laborious process.
sentences.chinese: 鑲板繪畫是個費心費力的過程。

sentences.english: Don't bother chamfering the edges until the end.
sentences.chinese: 不用費心管倒角孔的邊緣，直到結束。

sentences.english: I tried to attract her attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想引起他的注意，卻枉費心機。

sentences.english: My brother-in-law said loudly, to bother you.
sentences.chinese: 高聲說我的小舅子，勞你費心了。

sentences.english: The consumption of God to work, have rich harvest.
sentences.chinese: 有了耗神費心的勞作，纔有了豐厚的收穫。

sentences.english: Less than 40 per cent of businesses bother to check academic and professional qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 不足40百分號的企業會費心覈查教育和職業資歷。
她的謹慎只是枉費心機。

sentences.english: Geminis are impossible to predict, so we shouldn't bother trying.
sentences.chinese: 雙子座的人無法預料，所以我們也無須費心去嘗試了。

sentences.english: Olmsted wrote often and thought hard about the words he used.
sentences.chinese: 奧姆斯特德經常寫作，往往費心思考自己的用詞。

sentences.english: You really go out of the way to make me feel welcome.
sentences.chinese: 你真是煞費心思來讓我感受到歡迎。

sentences.english: I am afraid you will be futile.
'In vain, ' quoth she, 'I live, and seek in vain.
sentences.chinese: “我枉自活着，”她說，“而我又枉費心思。

sentences.english: I tried to attract his attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想要引起他的注意，卻枉費心機。

definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to expend a great deal of effort
to use one's brain
to cherish/to treasure/to use sparingly
many and complicated/mired in minor details
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
as one wishes/according to one's wishes/at will/voluntary/conscious
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
mature reflection/after careful deliberations
to blame/to rebuke
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to decline (an appointment, invitation etc)
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
